Nothing happens in the GUI when trying to share a local java project
below the result in the .log file
Checks I did:
   - in the jar file org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui_2.1.0 is still the same sized class
     ConfigurationWizardAutoconnectPage as in the ziped distribution
   - creating a new workspace directory with new .metadata by eclipse doesn't
     change anything -> the exceptions still occures
   - this feature was working fine for about 4 weeks after the install (I'm 
     sorry I can't tell a more accurate time)

Additional installed Plugins:
   - com.assisi.v4e_2.1.0.17
   - com.omondo.uml.1.2.1
   - net.sf.colorer_0.4.0

This looks like a plugin initialization problem. Does restarting Eclipse fix 
the problem? Does the problem occur with a new workspace. This is a shot in 
the dark but could you rename the .metadata/.config folder found in your 
workspace and see if it fixes the problem (don't delete the .config folder 
because, if it is a cause of the problem, the contents may be of interest).

Q1 Does restarting Eclipse fix the problem?
A1 NO, no change at all.

Q2 Does the problem occur with a new workspace?
A2 YES, and again no change to the problem.
 
Q3 Rename the .metadata/.config folder found in your 
   workspace and see if it fixes the problem (don't delete the .config folder 
   because, if it is a cause of the problem, the contents may be of interest).
A3 Sorry, I've already found a solution to the problem. I can't test it with the
   installation anymore.

Solution:  1. Rename original eclipse directory
           2. Unzip the install package of eclipse into a new directory
           3. Start the new eclipse (parameter -data points to the old 
              workspace directory)
           -> now everything is fine again!
